dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Mag 7, crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos
News Content: This is The Takeaway from today's Morning Brief, which you can sign up to receive in your inbox every morning along with:

The chart of the day What we're watching What we're reading Economic data releases and earnings

Coverage of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, each year is something I view as a competitive sport.

I actually start training for the intense week over the summer, as my few close friends know (and yes, they all make fun of me). The number of workouts every week in the lead-up rises incrementally so I can easily sprint up and down the two-mile promenade with a backpack to stuff in as many meetings as humanly possible (yes, I do this).

My one cheat meal a week gets replaced by green drinks and extra doses of vitamins to ensure I don't get sick. I meditate twice a day and carefully pick out clothes I know will help me execute at the highest level. Look good, feel good, good things happen.

To me, this one event is the closest I will get to being like Michael Jordan in the playoffs — and I am very lucky to be in attendance.

And this year, the gathering of the elites flying in on private jets to wax poetic on the world's biggest problems will be extra nutty.

Read more: Here are the biggest global risks for 2025

The conference unofficially kicks off on Trump's Inauguration Day. Some CEOs I know who normally would be at Davos all week are dropping in mid-week after working the inauguration party rounds. By Tuesday, the newly minted president may have uncorked a host of executive orders that could impact the businesses of the top CEOs on the ground. And, of course, impact the global markets.

This is why this year's WEF will be more important than the norm for you, the average investor. The headlines will be coming in hot and heavy as CEOs look to challenge Trump or get on his good side. They will also look to talk up their businesses ahead of the start of earnings season, and with markets getting a little rockier of late.

Here's what yours truly and our very own Jennifer Schonberger will be watching while bundled up in five layers all week. Be sure to bookmark the "streaming now" section on Yahoo Finance to catch all our market-moving interviews in real-time. Or tune in where you normally catch us, whether that's on Samsung TV or our nifty app.

Unlike our previous trips to Davos over the past decade, I will be taping several special episodes of the Opening Bid podcast on the ground. I could tell you who those guests will be, but where is the fun in that? Best to be surprised!

Story Continues

Now, on to that guide...

Big bank CEOs: The biggest names in banking, such as JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon, Bank of America (BAC) CEO Brian Moynihan, Goldman Sachs (GS) CEO David Solomon, Citi (C) CEO Jane Fraser, and Morgan Stanley (MS) CEO Ted Pick will be in attendance. While this group will all get asked about Trump policies, it's going to be their outlook on interest rates that will be most key to market sentiment. Most have not spoken publicly since the Fed signaled a likely halt in rate cuts last month, and they will want to be heard ahead of the Fed's Jan. 28-29 policy meeting.

The tariff CEOs: Retail will have a nice showing at Davos, with the CEOs of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL), Williams Sonoma (WSM), and Gap (GAP) (their CEO's first time at the event) making the rounds. These companies are right in the middle of the tariff debate. I'll be interested in how they are preparing for Trump tariffs from a supply chain perspective. I am also interested in how much they could raise prices post-tariffs — it could offer up valuable insight into the 2025 inflation outlook and Fed policy.

The race to catch Nvidia: It will be another year of AI chatter throughout the halls of Davos. This time, I think the discussions will take two forms. First, unlike last year, where the AI discussions were mostly about potential, investors are going to want to see clear lines to revenue and profits. So I encourage AI CEOs to bring it. And two, we will probably hear more about how Big Tech players in Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are aiming to develop their own high-powered AI chips to catch Nvidia (NVDA), or at least make good enough chips to diversify. Leaders from OpenAI and Anthropic will also be in attendance, and their thoughts on chips could be key. I'll be watching Nvidia's stock price like a hawk this week, and you should be as well.

Crypto delegation: The crypto industry has had a solid presence at Davos in the past five years. This year the industry is expected to be out in force, headlined by an appearance from Coinbase (COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong. I'll be quite attuned to what the crypto crowd thinks about the latest volatility in bitcoin, MicroStrategy's (MSTR) bitcoin buying binge, what they are hearing from the pro-crypto Trump administration, and early assessments on Paul Atkins as the likely next SEC chairman.

And of course, the new Trump coin that debuted to much fanfare (and market cap) on Friday.

Stocks: Stocks are beginning to look top-heavy (especially the Magnificent 7), as I have reported. I'm eager to hear from market pros such as JPMorgan's Mary Erdoes and economic experts like Nouriel Roubini on if they are seeing red flags on the horizon. Any calls they make at this Davos may hold greater weight given more volatile market conditions and increased Trump policy uncertainty.

The political wild cards: As of this writing, contacts have told me President-elect Donald Trump plans to send delegates to Davos. Who precisely gets the nod is the wild card. (I fancy it will be potential Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, a Davos party scene regular for many years. Elon has long hated Davos, so hard to see him appearing). Trump himself is slated to give a speech remotely on Thursday, a source told Yahoo Finance.

But who ultimately shows up from Trump's orbit — and what they say once touching down — could set the tone on US international relations right out of the gate. If a delegate arrives at Davos days after Trump takes actions that could weigh on the economic growth of foreign countries and then aims to explain the actions, best believe the inevitable headlines may not be so market-friendly.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news discusses the upcoming World Economic Forum in Davos, where significant discussions around economic policies, tariffs, and the impact of the new Trump administration are expected. Given that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a major player in the tech sector, any discussions regarding tariffs and economic policies could directly impact its stock price. The mention of potential volatility in the markets and the focus on interest rates may create uncertainty, which could lead to a cautious sentiment among investors. However, the overall tone of the news suggests that there will be significant engagement from CEOs, which could also lead to positive sentiment if favorable discussions occur. Therefore, the probabilities are relatively balanced, with a slight inclination towards a potential rise due to the engagement at Davos.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos and potential market-moving events. While Apple (AAPL) isn't directly mentioned, the article discusses several factors that could indirectly impact its stock price. These include: 

*   **Macroeconomic factors:** Discussions on interest rates by big bank CEOs, potential Trump tariffs, and the overall economic outlook could influence investor sentiment towards tech stocks like Apple.
*   **AI competition:** The article highlights the race to catch Nvidia in the AI chip market, with Microsoft and Alphabet aiming to develop their own chips. This increased competition could indirectly affect Apple's future AI strategies and investments.
*   **Market Sentiment:** The article mentions that stocks are beginning to look top-heavy, especially the Magnificent 7, which includes Apple. This suggests a potential for a market correction.
*   **Political Uncertainty:** Trump's policies and potential actions could create market volatility, impacting Apple's international operations and supply chain.

Considering these factors, the news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While there are no direct negative mentions, the potential for market volatility, increased competition in AI, and macroeconomic uncertainties suggest a slightly higher probability of a stock price fall than a rise in the short term. The article doesn't contain any direct positive catalysts for Apple's stock price.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including banking, retail, AI, and crypto.  While Apple (AAPL) isn't directly mentioned, the article highlights several factors that could indirectly influence its stock price.  The "Magnificent 7" (which includes Apple) are mentioned as potentially looking top-heavy, suggesting a possible risk of a price decline.  The uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies and their potential impact on global markets adds to the overall market volatility, which could negatively affect Apple's stock.  The focus on AI and the potential competition for Nvidia could indirectly impact Apple's valuation if investors shift their focus to other tech companies.  However, Apple's strong fundamentals and consistent performance could mitigate some of these negative factors.  Given the overall uncertainty and the potential for negative market sentiment, the probability of a price fall is slightly higher than a price rise.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article discusses various topics that could impact the stock market, including the World Economic Forum in Davos, potential Trump policies, AI developments, and crypto trends. However, Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the content. The article focuses more on broader market themes and other companies like Nvidia, Coinbase, and major banks. Given the lack of direct relevance to Apple, the impact on AAPL's stock price is likely minimal. The probabilities are estimated based on the indirect nature of the news and the general market sentiment discussed.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the market. While the article mentions various companies and sectors, it specifically highlights the 'Magnificent 7' (Mag7), which includes Apple Inc. (AAPL). The overall tone of the article suggests increased uncertainty and potential market volatility due to various factors including Trump's policies, tariffs, and Fed actions. However, there is no directly negative news about Apple Inc. itself in the provided article. Given that AAPL is part of the Mag7 and considering the general market conditions discussed, there's a slightly higher likelihood of a stock price fall due to overall market uncertainty, but the impact is not explicitly clear.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. The article mentions various topics that will be discussed, including Trump policies, tariffs, interest rates, AI, and crypto. While the article does not specifically mention Apple Inc., it does mention other big tech companies like Microsoft and Alphabet, which could have an indirect impact on Apple's stock price. The overall tone of the article suggests that the market is expecting significant news and announcements from the conference, which could lead to increased volatility. Given the lack of direct information about Apple Inc. in the article, the probability of the stock price rising or falling is uncertain. However, considering the general market sentiment and the potential for surprise announcements, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling due to potential negative news or announcements.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including Trump policies, tariffs, AI developments, and cryptocurrency trends. These factors significantly influence the stock market, especially large market players like Apple Inc. The report indicates potential volatility and uncertainty, which can affect stock prices. However, Apple's diversified portfolio and strong market position may mitigate the impact of these factors.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, highlighting various macroeconomic factors, including potential Trump policies, tariffs, and AI competition, which could create uncertainty in the market. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is part of the 'Magnificent 7', the overall tone suggests increased volatility and caution among investors. The lack of direct positive news about Apple and the mention of potential market corrections lead to a higher probability of a stock price fall. However, Apple's strong fundamentals may provide some support against negative sentiment. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a cautious outlook with a slight inclination towards a price decline.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The previous rounds show a consistent leaning towards a negative impact on Apple's stock price due to the uncertainties discussed at Davos. The focus on potential Trump tariffs, interest rate outlook, and the 'top-heavy' nature of the Magnificent 7 (including Apple) all contribute to this sentiment. While the news doesn't directly target Apple, the indirect effects of these macroeconomic factors and market sentiment are likely to weigh on the stock. The AI competition mentioned could also be a long-term concern. Given the trend in previous predictions and the lack of positive catalysts in the news, I'm maintaining a higher probability of a stock price fall.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.38, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.62, Reasoning: The news piece focuses on the Davos World Economic Forum and its potential impact on various sectors, with a significant emphasis on macroeconomic factors and political uncertainty. While Apple (AAPL) isn't directly mentioned, the article highlights several factors that could indirectly influence its stock price.  The mention of the 'Magnificent Seven' (including AAPL) being 'top-heavy' suggests a potential for a market correction, increasing the likelihood of a price decline.  The uncertainty surrounding Trump's policies, potential tariffs, and the Fed's actions contribute to an overall volatile market environment, which could negatively affect Apple.  The lack of specific positive news regarding Apple, coupled with the prevailing uncertainty, tilts the probability towards a price fall.  However, Apple's strong fundamentals and consistent performance could partially mitigate these negative factors.  Considering the previous predictions, which largely lean towards a higher probability of a price fall, and the overall tone of the news, a slightly higher probability of a price fall is assigned.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news primarily focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential implications for various sectors and companies. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned, the article discusses broader market themes such as macroeconomic uncertainty, Trump policies, tariffs, and AI developments that could indirectly impact large-cap tech stocks like Apple. The mention of the 'Magnificent 7' (which includes Apple) potentially looking 'top-heavy' suggests a cautious outlook for these stocks. Additionally, the overall tone of the article leans towards market volatility and uncertainty, which could negatively affect investor sentiment. Given these factors, the probability of Apple's stock price falling is slightly higher than it rising in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned, the article highlights several factors that could indirectly influence its stock price. These include macroeconomic uncertainties, potential Trump tariffs, AI competition, and overall market volatility. The 'Magnificent 7', which includes Apple, is mentioned as potentially looking top-heavy, suggesting a risk of a price decline. However, there is no direct negative news about Apple Inc. itself. Given the general market sentiment and potential for surprise announcements, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling due to potential negative news or announcements.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on the market, including discussions on Trump policies, tariffs, interest rates, AI, and crypto. While Apple Inc. is not directly mentioned, the article highlights the 'Magnificent 7' (Mag7), which includes Apple. The overall tone suggests increased uncertainty and potential market volatility. Considering the lack of direct information about Apple Inc. and the general market sentiment, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling due to potential negative news or announcements. However, the strong fundamentals and consistent performance of Apple could mitigate some of these negative factors.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news covers multiple macroeconomic and geopolitical factors including Trump policies, tariffs, AI developments, and cryptocurrency trends. These factors significantly influence the stock market, especially large market players like Apple Inc. The report indicates potential volatility and uncertainty, which can affect stock prices. However, Apple's diversified portfolio and strong market position may mitigate the impact of these factors. The previous predictions suggest a mixed sentiment with a slight tilt towards a potential stock price fall due to the overall market uncertainty and potential for negative news or announcements.

}
